mrdrivers 0.6.6

Read WDI

Source: R/readWDI.R
readWDI.Rd

Read-in WDI (World development indicators) data .Rds file as magpie object.

Usage

readWDI(subtype)

convertWDI(x, subtype)

Arguments

subtype

A string. Type of WDI data that should be read. Use the worldbank indicator abbreviation. Available subtypes are:

  • "SP.POP.TOTL": Population, total

  • "NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.KD": GDP,PPP (constant 2017 international Dollar)

  • "NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.CD": GDP, PPP (current international Dollar)

  • "NY.GDP.MKTP.CD": GDP MER (current US Dollar)

  • "NY.GDP.MKTP.KD": GDP MER (constant 2010 USDollar)

  • "NY.GDP.MKTP.KN": GDP LCU (constant LCU)

  • "NY.GDP.MKTP.CN": GDP LCU (current LCU)

  • "NY.GDP.DEFL.KD.ZG": Country GDP deflator (annual %)

  • "SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS": Urban population (percentage of total)

  • "NY.GDP.PCAP.CN":GDP, LCU, per capita (current LCU)

  • "NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.KD": GDP PPP, per capita (2017 international $)

  • "NY.GDP.PCAP.KD": GDP, MER, per capita (2010 US$)

  • "NV.AGR.TOTL.KD": Ag GDP, MER, (2010 US$)

  • "NV.AGR.TOTL.CD": Ag GDP, MER, (current US$)

  • "NY.GDP.PCAP.CD": GDP MER, per capita(current US$)

  • "NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD": GDP PPP, per capita (current int$)

  • "PA.NUS.PPPC.RF": Price level ratio of PPP conversion factor (GDP) to market exchange rate

x

MAgPIE object returned by readWDI

Value

A magpie object of the WDI data

Functions

  • convertWDI: Convert WDI data

See also

madrat::readSource()

Other "Past" GDPpc functions: readJames2019(), readPWT()

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(mrdrivers)
readSource("WDI", subtype = "SP.POP.TOTL")
}
